summary:
This mod adds two new horses to the Dawnguard DLC questline.

* Horses equipped with custom magical cloaks.
* Summon/Un-summon spell.
descriptionHtml:
Adds two new horses to the Dawnguard DLC questline. Horses are enabled after you initially speak with Harkon and have chosen a side (Vampire or Dawnguard).

[color=RED]Shadow - Vampire Questline[/color]
[i]'Shadow' is located at the Volkihar castle docks and is set to the players faction. Shadow is fast, agile, and comes with a custom cloak that envelops your enemies in a cloud of bats, draining their life force as the seconds tick away. The cloak is activated when in combat and your enemy is in a close radius to your steed.[/i]

[color=LIGHTBLUE]Phoenix - Dawnguard Questline[/color]
[i]'Phoenix' is located at the Fort Dawnguard camp area and is set to the players faction. Phoenix is fast, agile, and has increased stamina. This horse is equipped with a 'Holy Aura' which surrounds itself in a shroud of fiery light and does sun damage to any enemy that dares to approach. Damage is increased if the target is undead.[/i]

* All cloaks are activated in combat and deactivate when not.
* Compatible with [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/14950]Convenient Horses[/url] mod.
* You can now turn on/off the combat cloaks by bringing up the console and tying 'set horsecombatcloak to 0'

[center][color=ORANGE][b]SEE THE EFFECTS IN ACTION![/b][/color][/center]

[center][b][color=RED]SHADOW[/color]<------->[color=LIGHTBLUE]PHOENIX[/color][/b][/center]
[center][youtube]1mQN65n9p_8[/youtube][youtube]g7JTuiZdMQ4[/youtube][/center]
[center][youtube]ONSxbGKOVfQ[/youtube][/center]
[center][color=ORANGE][b]CUSTOM SUMMON SPELL[/b][/color][/center]


[u][b]Info:[/b][/u]

1. In addition to the horses, two spell books can be found in their general vicinity. These books allow you to summon/un-summon your horse using a custom conjuration spell.

2. Both books will be enabled after you have chosen a side, in case you would prefer to use a different steed. Simply find the book and summon the horse.

[color=RED]Summon Shadow Spell Book - Located at Volkihar docks.[/color]
[color=LIGHTBLUE]Summon Phoenix Spell Book - Located at Fort Dawnguard camp.[/color]


[color=ORANGE][b]I highly recommend using the [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3200/?tab=3&navtag=%2Fajax%2Fmodimages%2F%3Fuser%3D0%26id%3D3200]ORNANTE SADDLES MOD[/url] to improve the look of both horses.[/b][/color]


[u][b]Updates:[/b][/u]
[b]
1.8

[/b]- Fixed missing horse mane fore-locks.

- Created new sound effects for summon spells.

- Created new summon spell effect for White Horse.[b]

1.7[/b]

- Created new summon scripts and effects to fix issue with previous version. No more double summon portal.

[b]1.6[/b]

- For some reason the summon effects stopped working, so I added a generic effect for both horses until I can fix the issue.

- Changed location of the White Horse quest book. Spawns on stump near campfire now.

- Added global variable to turn on/off the combat cloaks.

[b]1.5[/b]

- Fixed quest script initialization.

- Fixed missing horse mane fore-locks.

- Created new sound effects for summon spells.

- Created new summon spell effect for White Horse.


[u][b]Requirements:[/b][/u]

- Dawnguard


[u][b]Credits:[/b][/u]

Horse textures by AlienSlof.


[u][b]Installation: [/b][/u]

1. Use NMM installer.

or

2. Install manually by adding Dawnguard_Horses.esp to Skyrim\Data folder.
3. Add texture + meshes + scripts folders to Skyrim\Data folder.


[u][b]Uninstall:[/b][/u]

1. Deactivate with NMM.

or

2. Remove Dawnguard_Horses.esp from Skyrim/Data folder.
3. Remove ShadowSteed.nif and WhiteSteed.nif from Skyrim\Data\Meshes\actors\Horse\character assets folder.
4. Remove any .dds file labeled 'Shadow' or 'White' from Skyrim\Data\textures\actors\horse folder.
5. Remove SummonShadowScript.pex, SummonWhiteHorseScript.pex, and DLC1DarkLightHorseQuestScript.pex from Skyrim\Data\Scripts folder.
